statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 2 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ -5 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ 3 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 3 \\ -3 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -15 \\ -10 \\ 10 \\ 10 \\ 19 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 2 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ -5 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ 3 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 3 \\ -3 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -15 \\ -10 \\ 10 \\ 10 \\ 19 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
